entities.name: LICENSING SOLUTION PARTNERS
entities.description: Licensing solution partners (LSP) license Microsoft's products and services indirectly and primarily engage with large organizations.

entities.name: DISTRIBUTORS
entities.description: Distributors license Microsoft's products and services indirectly, primarily reselling to value-added resellers (VARs).

entities.name: VALUE-ADDED RESELLERS
entities.description: Value-added resellers (VARs) license Microsoft's products and services indirectly and typically reach small and medium organizations.

entities.name: RETAILERS
entities.description: Retailers license Microsoft's products and services indirectly and distribute devices through third-party retailers.

entities.name: ESAS
entities.description: ESAs are typically authorized as LSPs and operate as resellers for Microsoft's volume licensing programs.

entities.name: MICROSOFT CLOUD SOLUTION PROVIDER
entities.description: Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider is the main partner program for reselling Microsoft's cloud services.

entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: Microsoft licenses cloud services, on-premises software, and SA to organizations under volume licensing agreements.

entities.name: ENTERPRISE AGREEMENT
entities.description: Enterprise Agreements are designed for medium or large organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software organization-wide over a three-year period.

entities.name: MICROSOFT PRODUCT AND SERVICES AGREEMENT
entities.description: Microsoft Product and Services Agreements are designed for medium and large organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software as needed, with no organization-wide commitment, under a single, non-expiring agreement.

entities.name: OPEN
entities.description: Open agreements are for small and medium organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software over a one- to three-year period.

entities.name: SELECT PLUS
entities.description: Select Plus agreements are designed for government and academic organizations to acquire on-premises licenses at any affiliate or department level.

entities.name: MICROSOFT ONLINE SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT
entities.description: Microsoft Online Subscription Agreements are for small and medium organizations to subscribe to, activate, provision, and maintain cloud services seamlessly and directly via the web.

relationships.relationship_description: Microsoft licenses its products and services indirectly through licensing solution partners (LSP).
Microsoft licenses its products and services indirectly through distributors who resell primarily to VARs.
Microsoft licenses its products and services indirectly through value-added resellers (VARs) who typically reach small and medium organizations.
Microsoft licenses its products and services indirectly through retailers who distribute devices through third-party retailers.
ESAs are typically authorized as LSPs and operate as resellers for Microsoft's volume licensing programs.
Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider is the main partner program for reselling Microsoft's cloud services.
Enterprise Agreements allow medium or large organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software organization-wide over a three-year period. SA is included.
Microsoft Product and Services Agreements allow medium and large organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software as needed, without an organization-wide commitment.
Open agreements allow small and medium organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software over a one- to three-year period.
Select Plus agreements allow government and academic organizations to acquire on-premises licenses at any affiliate or department level.
Microsoft Online Subscription Agreements allow small and medium organizations to subscribe to, activate, provision, and maintain cloud services directly via the web.
